strf_parameters.interpretation: Spatial scales (15.00, 15.00) on a 100×100 grid imply patchy surfaces with medium blobs. Variance σ≈1.000 yields high-variance fluctuations. Anisotropy (1.00, 1.00) gives a isotropic footprint, while temporal scale 5.00 over 20 scenarios points to short-lived costs. Correlation footprint suggests roughly 14 distinguishable hotspots at any time.

cost_surface_gif.interpretation: Average gradient intensity is 0.11× the field's own scale, indicating very smooth surfaces. High-cost peaks average 1.9 per scenario with prominence ≈0.187. Hotspots cover 5.0% of the grid and show stable hotspots. Peak locations shift by ~14.97 cells per step (fast-moving peaks), and gradients exhibit balanced gradients.

heatmap_gif.interpretation: Intensity spans [0.000, 1.000] with mean 0.508. Spatial variance averages 0.0145. Hotspots (95th percentile) occupy ~5.0% of cells and are stable over time. Centroid drift of 8.08 cells per step indicates moderate drift of dominant regions.

histogram_gif.interpretation: Scenario costs average 0.508 (median 0.507) with σ=0.031 (CV=0.06). Distribution is right-skewed (skew=0.32) with light tails (kurtosis=-0.99). Outliers beyond 3σ occur in 0.0% of scenarios. Later scenarios shift by -0.042 relative to early ones, signalling downward drift.

kde_gif.interpretation: KDE is unimodal with modes at 0.495. Density concentrates between 0.459 and 0.576, with tail mass of 92.9% outside ±1σ of the mean. Mode locations drift slightly as indicated by the GIF.

violin_gif.interpretation: Medians range from 0.474 to 0.555. IQR averages 0.196 (σ=0.019), indicating moderate spread with consistent spread across scenarios. Shape symmetry score 0.08 denotes mostly symmetric. Upper tails hold 49.5% of total tail mass, signalling balanced tails.
